title.value: Sustained IFN signaling is associated with delayed development of SARS-CoV-2- specific immunity
title.justification: The title is found at the beginning of the paper, summarizing the study's main finding about the relationship between sustained IFN signaling and SARS-CoV-2 immunity.
title.quote: Sustained IFN signaling is associated with delayed development of SARS-CoV-2- specific immunity

extractions.description: This study explores the relationship between IFN signaling and the development of SARS-CoV-2-specific immunity in COVID-19 patients. It identifies patient clusters based on plasma samples, revealing that sustained IFN signaling correlates with delayed antibody response, impacting clinical outcomes.

type.justification: The paper involves detailed empirical analysis, including profiling of plasma samples, computational modeling, and the use of patient data to establish findings about SARS-CoV-2 immunity.
type.quote: We profile 782 longitudinal plasma samples from 318 hospitalized COVID-19 patients.

name.justification: The research is focused on understanding the immune response to SARS-CoV-2, particularly the role of IFN signaling in antibody development.
name.quote: These results highlight a role for excessive IFN signaling in disrupting adaptive humoral and cellular immune responses to a human viral infection.

name.justification: The study is focused on a viral infection—SARS-CoV-2—and its interaction with the immune system.
name.quote: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) infection is a heterogeneous disease.

name.justification: The paper uses computational methods such as cluster analysis and dimensionality reduction to analyze data from plasma samples.
name.quote: Integrated analysis using k-means reveal four patient clusters in a discovery cohort.

name.value: PHATE (Potential of Heat-diffusion for Affinity-based Trajectory Embedding)
name.justification: The model is mentioned as a tool for dimensionality reduction in analyzing the dataset.
name.quote: PHATE is a manifold learning algorithm which computes a nonlinear transformation of the data to represent the latent structure of a dataset in low dimensions.

is_contributed.justification: PHATE is not a new model developed in this study but rather an existing tool used for analysis.
is_contributed.quote: Potential of Heat-diffusion for Affinity-based Trajectory Embedding (PHATE) is a manifold learning algorithm...

is_executed.justification: PHATE is applied to the dataset for dimensionality reduction, indicating it was executed in the study.
is_executed.quote: We first visualized samples on a 2D scatter plot using the PHATE dimensionality reduction algorithm.

is_compared.justification: PHATE is not compared numerically with other models but used as a tool for visualization and embedding of data.
is_compared.quote: We used MELD (v1.0.0) to obtain smooth visualizations of critical severity and fatal outcome in the DSO11 discover cohort.

referenced_paper_title.value: Visualizing structure and transitions in high-dimensional biological data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference paper title for PHATE is explicitly mentioned in the references section.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Moon KR, van Dijk, D, Wang, Z, Gigante, S, Burkhardt, D, Chen, WS et al. "Visualizing structure and transitions in high-dimensional biological data." Nat Biotechnol 37, 1482–1492 (2019).

name.justification: The dataset is used for collecting blood samples from COVID-19 patients as part of the study.
name.quote: admitted to the Centre Hospitalier de l’Université de Montréal (CHUM) or the Jewish General Hospital (JGH) and recruited into the Biobanque Québécoise de la COVID-19 (BQC19).

referenced_paper_title.value: Data from the BQC-19 repository is available after appropriate permissions and data access agreements
referenced_paper_title.justification: The Biobanque Québécoise de la COVID-19 (BQC19) is a repository mentioned explicitly in the context of available data.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Data from the BQC-19 repository is available after appropriate permissions and data access agreements (https://en.quebeccovidbiobank.ca).

name.justification: This validation cohort dataset is used to compare findings from a different geographical and hospital setting.
name.quote: The validation cohort was recruited at Uppsala University Hospital in Sweden... A validation cohort of 76 patients was collected from the Pronmed study biobank.

referenced_paper_title.value: Data from the Pronmed study is available from the SciLifeLab data repository after appropriate permissions and data access agreements
referenced_paper_title.justification: The Pronmed study biobank is explicitly mentioned in the context of data collection and availability.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Data from the Pronmed study is available from the SciLifeLab data repository after appropriate permissions and data access agreements (https://doi.org/10.17044/scilifelab.14229410).
